intro: Herrania tomentella, commonly known as the woolly Herrania, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
